content.title: カールのキャリアがどう変わったのか - 広告主
content.desc: But somehow, Nine’s golden boy has managed to overcome the intense public scrutiny and speculation about his future in TV with the network to get to the altar. Earlier this year, Nine’s CEO Hugh Marks even admitted that Karl’s private relationship drama had taken its toll. In September, Marks told The Australian: “No doubt the constant publicity surrounding issues with his personal life have had an impact on Karl, his colleagues and on the show. We can’t hide from that. And as a result we know there’s a lot of hard work to be done to win back the audience.” MORE: James Packer’s last-minute ...

content.title: マッコーリーメディアの株価が急騰 - オーストラリア
content.desc: Macquarie Media shares jumped more than 12 per cent yesterday after Nine Entertainment confirmed it was looking to mop up the shareholding of the radio company, home of 2GB’s top radio stars Alan Jones and Ray Hadley. Nine will own a 54.5 per cent stake in ASX-listed Macquarie Media after its $4 billion merger with Fairfax Media wraps up on Friday but that leaves the remaining 45.5 per cent up for grabs. Top advertising boss John Singleton is Macquarie Media’s second biggest shareholder with 32 per cent. The remaining balance is owned by minority shareholders, which include Wilson Asset Man...

content.title: 今日のショーで大規模な握手 - 広告主
content.desc: In an email to staff today, Channel 9 news director Darren Wick confirmed Calvert would leave the embattled breakfast program after five years at the helm. “From personal experience, I know there is no more challenging role in news and current affairs than the daily breakfast battle between Today and Sunrise. It’s a national ratings race where audience loyalty fluctuates from city to city, and often suburb to suburb,” Mr Wick wrote. “And there is no program on Australian television that is analysed, revised and criticised as much as Today. The hours are exhausting, the competition is intens...

content.title: カールのOTT結婚式について知っていることすべて - 広告主
content.desc: The couple, who became engaged in January after a whirlwind 11-month romance, have arrived in Los Angeles ahead of their Mexican nuptials this weekend. THE VENUE Stefanovic and Yarbrough will tie the knot at the luxurious One & Only Palmilla Resort in San Jose del Cabo on Saturday, December 8. The resort is a favourite of celebrities such as Cameron Diaz and Jennifer Aniston and was also where The Hills’ Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt eloped in 2008.
